title: Monthly Business Survey - Retail Sales Index

questions.title: On 12 January 2016 what was the number of employees for the business named above?
questions.description: An employee is anyone aged 16 years or over that your organisation directly pays from its payroll(s), in return for carrying out a full-time or part-time job or being on a training scheme.

responses.label: Male employees working more than 30 hours per week?
responses.guidance: How many men work normal hours?

responses.label: Male employees working less than 30 hours per week?
responses.guidance: How many men work short hours?

responses.label: Female employees working more than 30 hours per week?
responses.guidance: How many women work normal hours?

responses.label: Female employees working less than 30 hours per week?
responses.guidance: How many women work short hours?

responses.label: Total employees
responses.guidance: How many people work for you in total

questions.title: What are the dates of the sales period you are reporting for?
questions.description: If possible, this should be for the period [standard date period]

sections.title: Retail Turnover
sections.description:
Round your figures to the nearest (£) pound.

Include

  • VAT
  • Internet Sales

questions.title: For the reporting period stated above, what was the value of the business’s total sales of:

responses.label: Food
responses.guidance:
Include
  • VAT
  • internet sales
  • all fresh food
  • other food for human consumption (except chocolate and sugar confectionary)
  • soft drinks
Exclude
  • sales from catering facilities used by customers

responses.label: Other Goods
responses.guidance:
Include
  • VAT
  • internet sales
  • toiletries and medications (except NHS receipts)
  • newspapers and periodicals
  • books, stationery and office supplies
  • photographic and optical goods
  • spectacles, contact lenses and sunglasses
  • toys and games
  • cycles and cycle accessories
  • sport and camping equipment
  • jewellery
  • silverware and plate, clocks and watches
  • household cleaning products and kitchen paper products
  • pets, pets’ requisites and pet foods
  • cut flowers, plants, seeds and other garden sundries
  • other new and second hand goods
Exclude
  • revenue from mobile phone network commission and top up
  • lottery sales and commission from lottery sales
  • sales of car accessories and motor vehicles
  • NHS receipts

responses.label: Alcohol, Confectionary and Tobacco
responses.guidance:
Include
  • VAT
  • internet sales
  • all fresh food
  • other food for human consumption (except chocolate and sugar confectionary)
  • soft drinks
Exclude
  • sales from catering facilities used by customers

responses.label: Clothing and Footware
responses.guidance:
Include
  • VAT
  • internet sales
  • clothing and footwear
  • clothing fabrics
  • haberdashery and furs
  • leather and travel goods
  • handbags
  • umbrellas

responses.label: Total Retail Sales
responses.guidance:
Include
  • VAT
  • internet sales
  • retail sale from outlets in Great Britain to customers abroad
Exclude
  • revenue from mobile phone network commission and top up
  • lottery sales and commission from lottery sales
  • sales of car accessories and motor vehicles
  • NHS receipts

responses.label: Household goods
responses.guidance:
Include
  • VAT
  • internet sales
  • carpets, rugs and other floor coverings
  • furniture
  • household textiles and soft furnishings
  • prints and picture frames
  • antiques and works of art
  • domestic electrical appliance, audio/visual equipment and home computers
  • lighting and minor electrical supplies
  • records, compact discs, audio and video tapes
  • musical instruments and goods
  • decorators’ and DIY supplies
  • lawn-mowers
  • hardware
  • china, glassware and cutlery
  • novelties, souvenirs and gifts

responses.label: Of these figures, how much were from internet sales?
responses.guidance:
Include
  • VAT
  • sales from orders received over the internet, irrespective of the payment or delivery method.

responses.label: Please explain any movements in your data e.g. sale held, branches opened or sold, extreme weather, or temporary closure of shop
